intro: Erinus americanus, commonly known as the American erinus, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its fluffy, pink or white flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Erinus americanus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in garden settings.
